author: dp_specialist
content: maybe we can have a chat sometime?

author: siladu
content:
Yep I'm sure we can arrange something. What are you looking to achieve?

We already have an open PR for 4844 implementation which is close to being merged https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/5536

author: potuz
content: Essentially every core dev is one way or another involved in that

author: dp_specialist
content:
I was looking into the checklist here to see if there is something todo within the EFP

https://github.com/ethereum/pm/blob/master/Breakout-Room/4844-readiness-checklist.md

author: siladu
content: I'm sure there will be but you might find it's lots of small left over pieces that aren't very good as standalone projects (at least from Besu side, but probably other clients too). Biggest outstanding parts may be automated tests like Hive, but would have to check with the EF testing team for progress on that.

author: dp_specialist
content: well, at least is good to see that more sooner than later proto-danksharding will be implemented üòÅ

author: siladu
content: Don't just take my word for it though, still worth asking around, and depends on what size/scope of project you want to take on.

author: dp_specialist
content: well, maybe looking into the next steps after that?

content: Great, so what did you think

author: agnxsh
content: hey everyone, i was reading the yellow paper, and i'm having a doubt with the Bloom Filter portion, can anyone make me understand what's going on, i mean i do understand the "low order 11 bits of each of first three pairs part" but then i'm getting a bit lost on the notations.

author: agnxsh
content: for reference

author: agnxsh

author: siladu
content: Does this help? Python version of the spec... https://ethereum.github.io/execution-specs/autoapi/ethereum/berlin/bloom/index.html#add-to-bloom

author: agnxsh
content: yes the logic is much clearer here, thank you!
